snippet: After months of false starts and unfulfilled promises by Iraqi and American leaders for quick gains, a recent siege has finally yielded some success.
abstract: Iraqi security forces and tribal forces backed by United States air power are besieging city center of Ramadi over six months after it fell to Islamic State group.

byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY, FALIH HASSAN and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Anbar Province, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: After months of false starts and unfulfilled promises by Iraqi and American leaders for quick gains, a recent siege has finally yielded some success.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Advance in Campaign to Retake Ramadi From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Forces Advance in Campaign to Retake Ramadi From Islamic State

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
